result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Stock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

-No contact with firearms.

Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

-No contact with victim Pamela M. unless approved by the agent.
 Court grants third party contact for purpose of time with the children as approved by the agent, under the direction of the BMCW and per BMCW rules and restrictions including supervised visits.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J Stock

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO SHERYL B. OS
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is an absconder. No condition time requested.

Defendant Jeremy J Stock in court with attorney Bridget Krause on behalf of Colin P. McGinn.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (2 days straight time). The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16A 011414
Added count 2 court costs.
CLARIFICATION made to sentencing entry dated 3/28/2016 to reflect count on which condition time was stayed.

State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 20 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 days (on count 1) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Mental Health Evaluation.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Pamela M. unless approved by the agent. Court grants third party contact for purpose of time with the children as approved by the agent, under the direction of the BMCW and per BMCW rules and restrictions including supervised visits.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.

Defendant Jeremy J Stock in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts 3 and 4 Dismissed, But Read In.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jeremy J Stock in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CMC. Defense withdrew Speedy Trial Demand. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Court VACATES Jury Trial date. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Status Report.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Jeremy J Stock not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. State requests joinder. Court tenatively grants joinder. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
